title: Politicians, Guild Leaders Rally Outside ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live’ Studio, Urge Media Companies Not to Bow to Trump and FCC Pressure
description: Just an hour before ABC made the announcement that “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” would return to the airwaves on Tuesday, a group of politicians and Hollywood guild leaders held a press conference and rally in front...
body:
Just an hour before ABC made the announcement that “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” would return to the airwaves on Tuesday, a group of politicians and Hollywood guild leaders held a press conference and rally in front of the show’s Hollywood studio to urge Disney to bring the show back.

“Trump’s allies think the First Amendment comes with an asterisk,” said Rep. Laura Friedman (D-Calif. District 30). “They think that it means it gets free speech as long as Donald Trump likes it. But he does not get to silence dissent. He does not get to tell the American people what to say or what they can and cannot listen to… This is not just about a late night show. It’s about jobs and it’s about our rights as Americans. How the FCC’s job is to protect Americans, not the President’s ego. And I would remind every corporation in America and that many of their business models cannot survive in a world where the government gets to tell them what to say.”

Friedman pulled out a large copy of the First Amendment while adding, “You do not get to cancel the United States Constitution, not today, not tomorrow, not on our watch.”

The press conference did not go off without a hitch; a Trump supporter with a microphone loudspeaker attempted to drown out the event; that’s when attendees shouted back “Free speech!” Later, a low flying Fox 11/KTTV helicopter, which was getting video of the event, also drowned out some of the speakers.

Rep. Brad Sherman (D-Calif. District 32) attempted to point out that the far-right Charlie Kirk has now been lauded as a free speech absolutist — which is why, in his mind, muzzling Kimmel was hypocritical.

“This mafia administration is so bold that they do the language of the mafia in plain sight,” he said. “What this administration is doing, what Brendan Carr is to undermine the words of Charlie Kirk. Charlie Kirk said you should be allowed to say outrageous things. There is rogue speech, there is evil speech, and it is all protected by the First Amendment. Jimmy Kimmel did not contradict the words of Charlie Kirk. Donald Trump did. His FCC.”

Sherman than said that he personally, as a citizen, planned to boycott and businesses that advertised on ABC at 11:35 p.m. if Kimmel was not brought back. He also said if Kimmel returned, he would support those advertisers — which is presumably what he will now do.

“The First Amendment deals with what we do as a government, and the government should be concerned, but we are also private citizens,” he said. “And I, for one, will be looking at who’s advertising on ABC from 11:30 p.m. to 12:30 p.m. And speaking just for my own family, if we see Jimmy Kimmel, we’re going to watch those advertisers. And if we see alternative programming, we will be boycotting those who buy the time.”

Rep. Judy Chu (D-Calif. District 32), co-chairs the Congressional Creative Rights Caucus, warned that President Trump has been demanding Kimmel’s scalp for some time. “First, Trump wrote, more than two months ago that Jimmy Kimmel’s show should be canceled. Then last week, Trump’s FCC chair said that companies should take action on Kimmel, even saying that they can ‘either do it the easy way or the hard way.’ And the companies got the message.”

She then criticized Nexstar: “ABC’s largest distributor, which needs the FCC’s approval for a $6.2 billion merger, immediately followed his orders and preempted the show, and ABC took it off the air indefinitely. So this was not about comments that a comedian made about Charlie Kirk. This is about a president leveraging the power of the federal government to silence his critics, a plan he’s been open about four months. Now he’s saying that the FCC should go further and cancel the broadcasting licenses of networks that criticize him. Well, are we going to be bullied like that? Are we going to be silenced? Every single one of us has a responsibility to stand up for our constitutional rights that are under attack. And this doesn’t just fall on the shoulders of workers. We need corporations and their executives to start standing up to this coercion.”

Rep. Ted Lieu added that this is not just about Kimmel. “Last year, the Supreme Court ruled a unanimous decision that government officials cannot force third parties to punish or suppress the views that government officials is fake, and my message to ABC is very simple: You do not kneel,” he said. “What happens when you kneel? The bully comes after you again, and now the FCC chair Brendan Carr is threatening ABC because he doesn’t like the statements made by ‘The View.’ When is this going to stop? ABC, you have a choice. You can continue to be bowing or you can stand up for yourself, stand up for the First Amendment and invoke the protection of the First Amendment, an amendment that generations of Americans have given their blood, sweat and tears to defend. We will not kneel. We will continue to be true.”

And to prove his point, Lieu said: “I get to say things like Donald Trump is partly on Epstein files because he is all over the Epstein files.”

Other speakers at the event included Writers Guild of America-West president Meredith Stiehm, in addition to members of SAG-AFTRA, Teamsters, IATSE and other unions.

title: ‘Spider-Man: Brand New Day’ Pausing Production for a Week Following Tom Holland’s Concussion
description: “Spider-Man: Brand New Day” is pausing production for a week, after star Tom Holland suffered a concussion on set.  	The film — produced by Sony Pictures in partnership with Marvel Studios — has been shooting...
body:
“Spider-Man: Brand New Day” is pausing production for a week, after star Tom Holland suffered a concussion on set.

The film — produced by Sony Pictures in partnership with Marvel Studios — has been shooting since early August with director Destin Daniel Cretton. A source close to the production says that shooting is expected to start up again on Sept. 29, and will not have an impact on the film’s July 31, 2026, release date. No one else was injured in the incident on the Pinewood set in London, and Holland is recuperating “out of an abundance of caution,” says the source.

Last month, Sony marked the start of production by releasing a video of Holland on set on the first day in Glasgow, in an elaborate stunt sequence that had Holland, as Spider-Man, landing on a tank careening through the city.

“It’s funny, putting the suit on, it feels different this time, somehow,” Holland says in the video. “It’s also the first time we ever had fans on set day one, so it’s really exciting to share this with them. We’ve got some familiar faces on set. I’m just going to do my best, hopefully get it right, no pressure.”

Franchise regulars Zendaya and Jacob Batalon are returning for Holland’s fourth Spidey film, along with newcomers Sadie Sink, Liza Colón-Zayas and Tramell Tillman. Mark Ruffalo is set to play Bruce Banner (aka the Hulk), alongside Jon Bernthal as Frank Castle (aka the Punisher) and Michael Mando, reprising his role as Mac Gargan (aka Scorpion) from 2017’s “Spider-Man: Homecoming.”

“Brand New Day” is written by regular Spidey scribes Chris McKenna and Erik Sommers, with Amy Pascal and Kevin Feige producing.

Deadline first reported the suspension of production.

title: ‘Monday Night Football’: How to Watch Detroit Lions vs. Baltimore Ravens Live Online Without Cable
description: If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.  	End a long weekend of NFL thrills with even more NFL actions on...
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

End a long weekend of NFL thrills with even more NFL actions on “Monday Night Football.”

For Week 3, “MNF” features two NFL powerhouses go head-to-head, as the Detroit Lions (1-1) face off against the Baltimore Ravens (1-1) at M&T Bank Stadium in Baltimore, Maryland.

“Monday Night Football” takes place on Monday, Sept. 22, with kickoffs at 8:15 p.m. ET/5:15 p.m. PT on ABC and ESPN.

Since “Monday Night Football” broadcasts on ABC and ESPN, the game is also available to watch online with web-based cable alternatives, like DirecTV — which offer a 5-day, and start at $49.99/month for new subscribers.

ABC is available with a subscription to and Fubo, Hulu + Live TV and Sling Orange + Blue (depending on your local TV market). Additionally, “Monday Night Football” livestreams on NFL+ for subscribers only.

Not a subscriber? You can purchase the livestream feed of the game starting at $6.99/month for the standard plan, or $49.99/year when you sign up for an annual subscription here. In addition, you can go with NFL+ Premium (comes with NFL Red Zone) for $14.99/month, or $99.99/year for the annual plan.

Aside from “Monday Night Football,” NFL+ is the home of all things NFL. The streaming service comes with live out-of-market local and primetime regular season games. It comes with access to postseason games, such as playoff games, the Pro Bowl and even the Super Bowl, with local and national radio game broadcasts, the NFL Network, NFL Films archive and more. It’s all streamable on smartphones, tablets, web browsers and smart TVs.

Tickets to the game are still available on TicketNetwork, Vivid Seats and SeatGeek. In fact, you can save $150 off when you spend $500 with promo code VARIETY150, or $300 off when you spend $1,000 with promo code VARIETY300 at TicketNetwork.com.

In addition, you can use code VAR2024 to take $20 off your ticket purchase at VividSeats.com, or you can use promo code VARIETY10 to save $10 at SeatGeek.com.

Starting at 8:15 p.m. ET/5:15 p.m. PT, “Monday Night Football” Lions vs. Ravens broadcasts on ABC and ESPN via DirecTV, as well as livestreams on NFL+ and ESPN Unlimited.

title: Everything to Know About Amazon’s October Prime Day: Dates, Discounts and More
description: If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.  	Fall is here, and you know what that means: Amazon’s October deals...
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

Fall is here, and you know what that means: Amazon’s October deals event is imminent.

Amazon Prime Big Deal Days takes place Oct 7-8, with the awkwardly-named shopping event promising two days of deals and discounts ahead of the holidays. Better known as “Fall Prime Day” or “Prime Day Part Two,” the 48-hour event promises up to 60% off top electronics, clothing, beauty products and gift ideas for the holidays.

Read on to find out more about the best discounts and offers for Prime Big Deals Day 2025.

When Is Prime Big Deal Days 2025? Date, Time

It’s official: Amazon’s fall Prime Day event kicks off October 7 at 12:01 a.m P.T. and runs until October 8 at 11:59 p.m.

What Are the Best Prime Big Deal Days Offers and Discounts?

Amazon says to expect thousands of new deals and discounts during its Prime Day shopping event, with new deals dropping every five minutes (during peak periods).

As usual, the best Prime Big Deal Days discounts will be on Amazon devices, like Echo speakers, Ring cameras and Fire TV sticks, all of which will be up to 60% off. Many of these deals will go live at 12 am on Oct. 7.

Below, beck out some of the products likely to go on sale (and sell out fast):

Amazon Fire HD 8 Tablet

The current deal saves you 54% off a brand new eight-inch tablet with full HD display, 64 GB of space and up to 13 hours of battery life.

It’s a great tablet for reading and streaming at home, or to take with you on your daily commute or on vacation.

In addition to its usual Alexa-enabled devices, Amazon also has up to 60% off Blink security cameras, plus up to 40% off Luna gaming controllers and up to 40% off the popular eero mesh WiFi system.

AMAZON DEAL

Blink Mini Compact Indoor Smart Security Camera

One of the best deals is on the Blink Mini smart home security camera, which is currently available for under $30. More than 10,000 Amazon shoppers have purchased this HD cam in the last month alone, praising its night vision, motion detection and two-way talk.

Many of the best Prime Big Deal Days discounts also include up to 40% off fashion must-haves from Amazon Essentials and deals on Halloween costumes and accessories (starting at just $5).

In terms of specific brands on sale for Prime Big Deal Days, Amazon is already churning out unbeatable deals on brands like Beats, Clinique, Coach, Disney, Fujifilm, JBL, KitchenAid, LEGO, Samsung, Too Faced Cosmetics, and more. The deals span all of Amazon’s categories, including electronics, beauty, fashion and home.

Do You Need to Be a Prime Member to Shop Prime Big Deal Days?

In short, yes. While Amazon offers daily deals all the time, the majority of deals during Prime Day are reserved for Amazon Prime members. Not a member? Get a 30-day free trial here to test out the service, and use it to shop the Prime Big Deal Days sale.

Top October Prime Day Deals:

We’ve rounded up some of the best Prime Day deals from last year (note: prices and discounts were accurate at time of this article’s publication). Some of the products already boast steep deals, but their PBDD deals won’t go live until the Oct. 7 so bookmark this page as we update it throughout the two-day event next month.

JBL Tune Flex – True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds (Black), Small

Get these top-rated JBL earbuds for under $60 — an almost-unheard of price for noise cancelling buds. The earbuds deliver crisp, clear audio, two types of noise cancellation, and up to 32 hours of battery life with the included charging case.

Amazon Echo Dot (5th Gen)

The popular smart speaker with Alexa built-in gets discounted every Prime Day.

Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K Streaming Device

Get access to all your favorite streaming apps in one easy device. This Fire TV Stick supports content in up to 4K quality.

Blink Outdoor 4 Wireless Smart Security Camera

Get a three-pack of the best-selling Blink smart security camera for a discount. The outdoor camera features two-way audio, HD viewing and a two-year battery life.

Ninja CREAMi

Also in the blender famil is the Ninja CREAMi. This is, hands down, the best ice cream maker available for the home. It makes small batches of restaurant-quality ice cream and frozen treats super fast. It has around 6,000 reviews on Amazon, so it’s been tried and tested. This device rarely goes on sale, so if you were thinking about gifting the CREAMi for the holidays, nows the time.

Ring Battery Doorbell

The popular Ring Video Doorbell is updated with “head to toe” viewing and better motion detection. Amazon had the 2024 version on sale for the first time for Prime Day, so we can expect an even steeper discount this year.

Oura Ring Gen3 Horizon

The celeb and athlete-approved Oura Ring almost never goes on sale, so this is a great opportunity to snag the fitness tracker for a discount. Choose from multiple colors and sizes on sale during Prime Big Deal Days.

FUDONI Projector With WiFi and Bluetooth

Get this portable projector during Prime Big Deal Days. The mini projector supports viewing in up to 4K quality, with easy streaming from your phone or laptop.

WOCKODER Vintage-Inspired Vinyl Record Player

More than a thousand people have bought this record player in the last month on Amazon, with reviewers touting its ease of use, Bluetooth pairing capabilities and surprisingly loud sound for its size.

Frameo 10.1-Inch WiFi Digital Picture Frame

Get a head start on gifting season with this Frameo digital picture frame, which lets you send photos directly to the device through WiFi.

TP-Link AC1200 WiFi Extender

Boost your WiFi signal and get better coverage throughout your home with a WiFi extender, like this new model from TP-Link.

VEWIOR True HEPA Air Purifier

This HEPA air purifier helps rid your home or office of smoke, odors, pet dander, and more. This one works on spaces up to 600-square-feet.

Efomao Executive Office Chair

Is this the most comfortable office chair ever? Made from a cruelty-free vegan leather, the executive desk chair features a leg rest, head rest, arm rest and tons of lumbar support.

Onlyone Water Dental Flosser

A number of personal care items are discounted for Prime Big Deal Days, including this best-selling water flosser which has five-star reviews from 90% of shoppers online.

Lefant Robot Vacuum Cleaner

October Prime Day is also a great time to pick up home appliances on sale, including robot vacuums like this one, which gets you two hours of runtime on a single charge.

DELSEY Paris Chatelet Air 2.0 Hardside Luggage Set

This traveler-loved luggage set gets you one hard-sided carry-on and one check-in suitcase in an elegant chocolate colorway.

title: How to Watch ‘Demon Slayer’ Anime Series Online
description: If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.  	One of the biggest movies of 2025 is “Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba...
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

One of the biggest movies of 2025 is “Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba — The Movie: Infinity Castle” with more than $555 million at the worldwide box office. It’s still a draw to theaters with more and more people discovering the anime, especially with Channing Tatum as part of the English-dubbed voice cast.

However, if you’re new to the “Demon Slayer” series, or just want to catch up with the anime before you watch the new movie, we have you covered. There are four seasons of TV episodes to watch before the movie, while the second and third parts of the epic film are expected for release sometime in 2027 and 2029, respectively.

But right now, as of this writing, all 63 episodes of “Demon Slayer” are available to stream on Crunchyroll for subscribers only.

If you’re not a subscriber, Crunchyroll offers new subscribers a 14-day free trial to try out the service before committing to a month-to-month service plan, which start at $7.99/month. Subscribers get access to anime with no ads, Crunchyroll‘s massive library, new episodes of popular series shortly after airing in Japan, 5% off select products from the Crunchyroll Stone and other perks.

Additionally, Crunchyroll is a channel add-on for Prime Video subscribers for the same prices.

Here’s how to watch the series in order, before you watch the movie:

  • “Demon Slayer”: Season 1 — “Tanjiro Kamado, Unwavering Resolve Arc” (2019)
  • “Demon Slayer”: Season 2 — “Mugen Train Arc and Entertainment District Arc” (2021-22)
  • “Demon Slayer”: Season 3 — “Swordsmith Village Arc” (2023)
  • “Demon Slayer”: Season 4 — “Hashira Training Arc” (2024)
  • “Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba — The Movie: Infinity Castle” (2025)

Next in the series:

  • “Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba — The Movie: Infinity Castle 2”
  • “Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba — The Movie: Infinity Castle 3”

Want to stream online? All episodes of “Demon Slayer” are streamable on Crunchyroll. At the moment, it’s unclear when “Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba — The Movie: Infinity Castle” is going to be available to stream at home.

Learn more about Crunchyroll’s plans, subscriber perks and title availability here.

title: Nara Smith Makes a Reformation Collection From Scratch
description: If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.  	Nara Smith has cooked something up, and it’s not homemade bubblegum...
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

Nara Smith has cooked something up, and it’s not homemade bubblegum or a DIY peanut butter-and-jelly sandwich but a new collection with Reformation.

The model and TikToker — whose videos making a variety of meals from scratch while dressed in superfluously extravagant clothing rack up millions of views — has partnered with the Los Angeles-based clothing brand on a 20-piece capsule collection. The vintage-inspired lineup includes gowns, two-piece suits, heels, sweaters and skirts — all sustainably made, and ranging in price from $148 to $448.

Standout pieces in the collection, which Smith models in campaign imagery released Monday morning, include a dramatic, sequined V-neck gown; a maroon two-piece skirt-jacket set in a striking silhouette; this breezy, polka-dot blouse; and this luxe, gingham PJ set.

Since launching in 2009, Reformation has carved out a place as fashion’s “cool girl” label, blending eco-friendly designs with Instagram-ready style. Best known for romantic slip dressed, vintage-inspired florals and flattering silhouettes, the brand has also built its reputation on sustainability, using deadstock fabrics, regenerative textiles and transparent impact reports. Their partnership with Smith is just one of many pop-culture tie-ins the brand has made in recent years to keep their pulse on the zeitgeist and tap into a new audience. Most recently, they partnered with Gen Z “It Girl” Devon Lee Carlson on a limited-edition line and Kacey Musgraves on a country-inspired collection.

Smith, meanwhile, has partnered with dozens of luxury brands, such as Marc Jacobs and Calvin Klein, throughout her career — first as a model, and now campaigns as a content creator. However, this collection is the time she has co-designed an original collection.

Shop the entire Nara Smith x Reformation collection here, and check out a few of the best pieces below:

title: Jimmy Kimmel Returns: ABC Ends Suspension Starting Tuesday
description: Jimmy Kimmel will have more to say on late-night TV.  	Disney and ABC will bring the comedian back to its schedule starting Tuesday night, after a decision to take his show, “Jimmy Kimmel Live,” off the air...
body:
Jimmy Kimmel will have more to say on late-night TV.

Disney and ABC will bring the comedian back to its schedule starting Tuesday night, after a decision to take his show, “Jimmy Kimmel Live,” off the air for an indefinite period of time. “Last Wednesday, we made the decision to suspend production on the show to avoid further inflaming a tense situation at an emotional moment for our country.  It is a decision we made because we felt some of the comments were ill-timed and thus insensitive,” the company said in a statement. “We have spent the last days having thoughtful conversations with Jimmy, and after those conversations, we reached the decision to return the show on Tuesday.”

Disney’s decision to bench one of its signature personalities came after two major station owners, Nexstar Media and Sinclair, said they would pre-empt his program following a Kimmel monologue last Monday during which he offered remarks tied to the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Those announcements came after Federal Communications Commission chair Brendan Carr appeared to suggest to broadcasters they ought to work to curb Kimmel and force ABC to remove him from its schedule.

And yet, after Kimmel was taken off the air, Disney faced protest from the creative community. On Monday, 400 celebrities — including people like Martin Short and Tom Hanks, who have created memorable characters for Disney in the recent past — signed a letter from the American Civil Liberties Union decrying the blow the maneuver delivered to free speech in America. First Amendment advocates from both sides of the political aisle have decried the situation in recent days.

The decision to bring Kimmel back was approved by Bob Iger, Disney’s CEO, and Dana Walden, co-chair of Disney Entertainment, according to a person familiar with the matter. The executives acted based on what was best for the company, this person said, and not on external factors. Indeed, it remains unclear if all ABC affiliates will air Kimmel’s program. Spokespersons for Nexstar and Sinclair could not be reached for immediate comment.

It is not clear if Kimmel will offer an apology for his remarks, but whatever he and Disney executives agreed to have him do will be seen Tuesday night. In the past, late-night hosts have had to tender apologies for remarks that offended, with David Letterman, Bill Maher and Samantha Bee among those who had to express regret for jokes or one-liners that caused more outrage than laughter.

The comedian offended conservatives by discussing some of the theories about Kirk’s death, caused by an assassin who shot him in Utah. “We hit some new lows over the weekend with the MAGA gang trying to characterize this kid who killed Charlie Kirk as anything other than one of them,” Kimmel said. He also poked fun at President Trump’s response to a question from the press about how he was mourning Kirk’s death after Trump pivoted to a discussion of the construction of a new White House ballroom.

Disney’s decision to take Kimmel off the air put a new spotlight on how uncertain traditional media companies have become in an era when the White House and the Federal Communications Commission pounce on individual reports with comments and legal pushback. President Trump has in recent months sued both ABC News and CBS News for comments made by ABC News anchor George Stephanopoulos and the editing of an interview with former U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris on “60 Minutes.” In both cases, the companies agreed to pay multi-million dollar settlements, even though the legal cases were deemed to be quite flimsy by experts.

In a different era, late-night hosts were more measured in their commentary. Johnny Carson famously kept his politics to himself, while poking fun at whoever happened to be in the White House. In recent years, however, hot talk and political humor have driven social-media chatter and viral pass-along — and ratings. Meanwhile, the audiences for the programs have begun to dwindle, with an increasing number of would-be viewers opting to sift through clips of the various shows on social media the day after the original episodes aired. Stephen Colbert’s “Late Show” on CBS has been the most watched of TV’s late-night programs as the host followed a theme of commenting on the latest headlines. For a good part of Colbert’s tenure on TV, President Trump has been at the center of them.

Such dynamics may be poised to cease. Paramount is getting out of the late-night business, and has canceled Colbert’s “Late Show,” which will end in May. While the company cited a downturn in advertising, there continue to be suspicions that Paramount Skydance’s new leader, David Ellison, wants to tamp down political sniping and is eager to cater to a more conservative base.

Kimmel’s return to wee-hours TV gives the comedian a little more time to enjoy his work. His current contract with ABC is expected to end in 2026, and people familiar with the host’s thinking say he’s been mulling stepping down from the role at some point in the near future. Whether that’s next year or after one or more new contract cycles remains to be seen.

title: John Legend, Irving Azoff, Kai Cenat Honored at Black Music Action Coalition Gala 2025 Following $500,000 Fire Relief Commitment
description: The Black Music Action Coalition held its fifth annual BMAC Gala in Los Angeles on Sept. 18 honoring John Legend, Irving Azoff and Kai Cenat, following its recent announcement of $500,000 committed to those...
body:
The Black Music Action Coalition held its fifth annual BMAC Gala in Los Angeles on Sept. 18 honoring John Legend, Irving Azoff and Kai Cenat, following its recent announcement of $500,000 committed to those affected by the Altadena fires earlier this year.

The event, staged at the Beverly Hilton, was hosted by Mickey Guyton, who set off the evening with a rendition of “Black Like Me.” Earth, Wind & Fire were on hand to perform “Just Groove” and “September in honor of Azoff, who received the BMAC Icon Award.

Surprise presenters included Babyface, who gave Legend the BMAC Quincy Jones Humanitarian Award; CeeLo Green, who honored Primary Wave Music with the BMAC 360 Award; Aminia Diop to Cenat and Apple & Apple Music for the BMAC Social Impact Award; Kamilah Forbes, who gave Sherrese Clarke and HarbourView Equity Partners the inaugural BMAC Harry Belafonte Change Agent Award; and Nicole Avant, who presented to Azoff.

While accepting his award, Legend told the audience, “Use your voice, use your platform, use your influence to fiercely protect those who are being brave, to shield the truth tellers facing retribution, to make space for more of us because the fight is as urgent as it’s ever been. Excellence is beautiful, it’s important, but freedom is more important.”

Willie “Prophet” Stiggers, BMAC CEO/co-founder/president, reflected on the non-profit’s growth over the past five years. “Tonight as we honor those who have used their platforms to drive real social change, let us recognize this truth – that BMAC is no longer just an organization. We are in fact the movement rooted in accountability and action, an unwavering belief that the future of music must be as just and as free and as powerful as the music itself.”

title: Malala Yousafzai and ‘Succession’ Actor Arian Moayed Board Afghanistan Doc ‘Champions of the Golden Valley’ as Executive Producers (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala Yousafzai and “Succession” actor Arian Moayed have signed on as executive producers of the feature documentary “Champions of the Golden Valley.”  	Directed by Ben Sturgulewski,...
body:
Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala Yousafzai and “Succession” actor Arian Moayed have signed on as executive producers of the feature documentary “Champions of the Golden Valley.”

Directed by Ben Sturgulewski, the doc follows former Afghan Olympic hopeful Alishah Farhangm as he brings together athletes of all ages and abilities from neighboring and often divided villages in the ancient Afghanistan mountain town of Bamyan to form a competitive ski community. An Oscar-qualifying theatrical run for “Champions of the Golden Valley” will begin on Oct. 31 in Los Angeles.

“Champions of the Golden Valley” is a moving and timely story about what joy and unity look like when everything else is falling apart,” Yousafzai said in a statement. “I’m proud to support this film and the young people whose courage and spirit it so beautifully captures.”

Moayed added, “Champions of the Golden Valley” resonates because it’s a story about people who refuse to stop dreaming. “These beautiful and resilient Afghans show us the power of what sport, community, and shared purpose can do, no matter what the obstacles may be.”

The doc premiered at the 2024 Tribeca Festival and has screened at over 50 festivals and received over 30 grand prize, jury, and audience awards, including best documentary at both SCAD Savannah Film Festival and Berkshire International Film Festival.

“Director Ben Sturgulewski captures an Afghanistan that few outsiders ever see in his exuberant debut feature film,” Tribeca Fest programmer Andrea Passafiume said. “A unique story that goes beyond skiing, ‘Champions of the Golden Valley’ is about resilience, finding joy amidst difficult circumstances, and what it means to be a champion.”

Yousafzai has supported several documentary projects. In 2023, Yousafzai boarded Oscar-shortlisted doc “Stranger at the Gate” as an executive producer. The film charted the surprising change of heart of a PTSD-suffering former U.S. Marine who set out to bomb a mosque but instead converted to Islam. In 2022, Yousafzai boarded “Joyland” as executive producer. The film tells the tale of a young Pakistani man from a patriarchal family who joins an erotic dance theater and falls for an ambitious transgender starlet.

Yousafzai began her activism by blogging about life in Pakistan under the Taliban and was shot in the head for speaking out. She received the Nobel Peace Prize in recognition of her work for education and equality. An Oxford University graduate and a self-professed TV fan, she struck a multi-year programming pact with Apple TV+ in 2021 through Extracurricular Productions, where she is president.

title: Row K Taps Mo Rhim as Chief Revenue Officer, Ben Carlson as Chief Marketing Officer and Steve Garrett as Distribution and Acquisitions Head (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Row K Entertainment, the newly launched theatrical distribution company, is filling out its core team. It has appointed three senior executives — Mo Rhim will join as chief revenue officer, Ben Carlson has...
body:
Row K Entertainment, the newly launched theatrical distribution company, is filling out its core team.

It has appointed three senior executives — Mo Rhim will join as chief revenue officer, Ben Carlson has been named chief marketing officer, and Steve Garrett will serve as head of distribution and acquisitions.

This announcement comes shortly after Row K, which was backed by Media Capital Technologies, made two major acquisitions out of the 2025 Toronto International Film Festival, where it launched. These included signing deals for Gus Van Sant’s “Dead Man’s Wire” starring Bill Skarsgård, Dacre Montgomery, Cary Elwes, Myha’la, Colman Domingo, and Al Pacino, as well as Tom Dean and Mac Eldridge’s “Charlie Harper” starring Nick Robinson and Emilia Jones.

Rhim, Carlson, and Garrett will work alongside Row K president Megan Colligan, a veteran executive who previously had leadership roles at Paramount and Imax.

“With Megan at the helm and Mo, Steve, and Ben joining the team, we’ve assembled a seasoned leadership group capable of managing every aspect of distribution. This gives the company a strong foundation to scale strategically and rapidly, while setting a new standard for filmmakers and audiences,” said MCT principals and Row K co-chairman Christopher Woodrow and Raj Singh. “Building on the momentum of our acquisitions at TIFF and leveraging this team’s track record, Row K is positioned to redefine the landscape as a bold, commercially driven distributor.”

“This team is composed of some of the most talented, multi-faceted executives in the business. Their combined expertise and breadth of knowledge give Row K the ability to move quickly, take risks, and innovate at a moment when the market is demanding it,” said Colligan. “We are building a modern studio for a modern audience, and this is exactly the right team to bring it to life.”

Rhim was the founder and CEO of The Advisory Collective, a strategic consultancy that helped corporations, brands, and creators in film, streaming, and interactive media develop next-generation business models, commercialization strategies and partnerships. Recently, she served as chief strategy officer at Imax, where she spearheaded initiatives to expand partnerships, content strategy, and interactive theatrical experiences across theatrical, out-of-home and in-home platforms. Previously, Rhim was the SVP of international digital marketing at Paramount Pictures, developing strategy across theatrical releases and regions. Rhim began her career at Google as the company’s first head of industry for media and entertainment, where she built strategic partnerships with Netflix and Warner Bros.

Carlson is an expert in audience insights and brand strategy, most recently serving as EVP and general manager of media, sports, and entertainment at MarketCast. He previously founded Fizziology, a social media analytics and predictive audience insights firm acquired by MarketCast in 2017, and earlier led brand strategy and creative innovation at Bradley and Montgomery.

Garrett most recently served as SVP, head of alternative and domestic distribution at Imax, where he managed the alternative content business for the global network alongside domestic studio releases. Prior to Imax, Garrett spent 15 years at Paramount Pictures, rising to SVP and general sales manager after serving as head of sales for Paramount Vantage.

title: Zayn Malik Announces Las Vegas Residency
description: Zayn Malik                          Viva, Las Vegas ...                          Announces Residency                                                                Published September 22, 2025 10:42 AM...
body:
Zayn Malik Viva, Las Vegas ... Announces Residency

Published September 22, 2025 10:42 AM PDT

Zayn Malik just revealed the big announcement he'd been teasing ... and it's a limited residency in Sin City.

The former One Direction heartthrob announced Monday he's got seven shows scheduled in Las Vegas this upcoming January ... and he'll be performing at Dolby Live at Park MGM.

Zayn had a countdown going on Las Vegas billboards over the weekend and had been teasing fans about a "big announcement coming up."

His Vegas shows kick off Jan. 20 and end Jan. 31.

Zayn toured earlier this year after postponing shows in 2024 following the death of his late 1D bandmate, Liam Payne ... but he had nothing on the calendar performance-wise until now.

Zayn's recently been spotted with his One Direction buddy Louis Tomlinson ... and folks are wondering if they might have some new music brewing.

Stay tuned ...

Related articles

    Zayn Malik Louis Tomlinson Liam Payne Hot Vegas Music

title: 'Spider-Man' Production Paused for Week Due to Tom Holland's Concussion
description: Tom Holland                          Should Be Web-Slinging in a Week!!!                          'Routine' Stunt Resulted in Mild...
body:
Tom Holland Should Be Web-Slinging in a Week!!! 'Routine' Stunt Resulted in Mild Concussion

Published September 22, 2025 1:00 PM PDT

Tom Holland's recent injury on the set of "Spider-Man: Brand New Day" happened during a "routine" stunt ... and is not expected to hold up production for long.

Sources with direct knowledge tell TMZ ... Tom suffered a bump on the head ... which resulted in a "minor" concussion when he fell.

We hear production is currently paused due to the incident ... but the stoppage is not expected to go past this week. That said, there is no exact date to resume rolling ... or should that be swinging?

Tom was checked out at the hospital for his mild concussion ... but was feeling well enough to attend a charity event with his costar/fiancée Zendaya afterward.

The Marvel-Sony movie is currently shooting in Glasgow ... they've been filming in Scotland over the last month.

"Spider-Man: Brand New Day" is slated for release in July 2026.

Feel better, Tom!

Related articles

    Tom Holland Movies Nurse! Marvel Health

title: TMZ Streaming Live, Come Into Our Newsroom and Watch Things Happen!
description: TMZ Live Stream                          Come Into Our Office and Watch News Happen!!!                                                                Published September 22, 2025 9:31 AM...
body:
TMZ Live Stream Come Into Our Office and Watch News Happen!!!

Published September 22, 2025 9:31 AM PDT | Updated September 22, 2025 12:11 PM PDT

We want you to be a part of TMZ, so every weekday, between 9:30 AM and 11:30 AM PT, we take you inside our newsroom via live stream.

You never know what you're gonna get ... a big story that breaks, an argument erupts in the room, or someone's just joking around.

Your comments are a big part of the stream, and the staff spends a lot of time speaking directly to you. Every day is different!

We also use our live stream to produce our "TMZ Live" TV show.

    Live Stream TMZ Live

title: Sarah Ferguson Axed by Charity After Gushing Jeffrey Epstein Email Leaked
description: Sarah Ferguson                          Charity Sticks a Fork in Duchess of York!!!                          Ferguson Booted Over Epstein...
body:
Sarah Ferguson Charity Sticks a Fork in Duchess of York!!! Ferguson Booted Over Epstein Email

Published September 22, 2025 9:34 AM PDT | Updated September 22, 2025 11:40 AM PDT

Sarah Ferguson was just dumped as the patron of a UK children’s hospice ... and it's all due to a sappy email she sent to Jeffrey Epstein.

The Duchess of York got the boot Monday ... the children's hospice Julia's House saying the split was over a leaked message SF sent to the convicted sex offender in 2011, People reports.

The shocking email in question was an apology to Epstein for Ferguson publicly disavowing him in the throes of his legal whirlwind after she took his money ... she tried to kiss up afterward and even called him a “supreme friend."

The BBC reported Ferguson became patron of Julia's House in 2018 ... but good luck finding any mention of that now -- 'cause her name has been scrubbed from the hospice website.

As we previously reported ... Ferguson's ex, Prince Andrew settled a lawsuit in 2022 with a woman who claimed the royal had sex with her when she was a minor.

The Duke of York and the late Virginia Giuffre reached an out-of-court settlement after she brought the suit against Andrew.

As you know ... despite his 2019 suicide, Epstein made a bunch of headlines this summer after the Department of Justice revealed the so-called "list" kept on celebs did not exist -- and announced there was no foul play in his death.

Obviously, that did not sit well with President Trump supporters who felt they were lied to over a guaranteed Epstein bombshell.

Related articles

    Jeffrey Epstein Royal Family Politix Charity News

title: Barack Obama & Michelle Obama, All Aboard Steven Spielberg’s Yacht
description: Barack Obama and Michelle Obama are once again putting those breakup rumors to rest ... 'cause they were spotted splashing out on Steven Spielberg’s $250 million superyacht in Italy!
body:
Barack & Michelle Obama Soaking Up the Sun in Italy ... On Steven Spielberg's Superyacht!!!

Published September 22, 2025 12:30 PM PDT

Barack Obama and Michelle Obama are once again putting those breakup rumors to rest ... 'cause they were spotted splashing out on Steven Spielberg’s $250 million superyacht in Italy!

Check out the pics ... the former first lady arrived in Portofino Friday -- without her hubby -- climbing aboard and greeting the famous filmmaker with a warm hug. He appeared enthused to see her show up, holding out his arms in anticipation of a friendly exchange.

She changed out of her trendy double denim outfit for a lunch with Steven and his wife, Kate Capshaw, on Saturday. Michelle seemed to enjoy their seaside rendezvous, as she was pictured grinning from ear to ear.

COBRA TEAM / BACKGRID

The former prez was photographed en route to the 357-foot yacht -- named Seven Seas -- later Saturday.

After a good night's sleep, the two power couples enjoyed lunch together while still docked in Portofino.

This is the first time Barack and Michelle have been photographed together in months ... though he was on his other half's podcast in July, during which they laughed off the divorce chatter.

Their meetup with Steven and Kate came as thousands poured into the State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona for Charlie's Kirk's official memorial event.

Barack announced he and Michelle were praying for Charlie's family after he had been shot, and more recently called his murder "horrific and a tragedy."

Related articles

    Steven Spielberg Michelle Obama Barack Obama Celebrity News Politix Photo Galleries Vacations
